entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French or Latin; Anglo-French, espirit, spirit, from Latin spiritus, literally, breath, from spirare to blow, breathe

def.dt: :an animating or vital principle held to give life to physical organisms
:a supernatural being or essence: as
:holy spirit
:soul 2a
:an often malevolent being that is bodiless but can become visible
:ghost 2
:a malevolent being that enters and possesses a human being
:temper or disposition of mind or outlook especially when vigorous or animated in high spirits
:the immaterial intelligent or sentient part of a person
:the activating or essential principle influencing a person acted in a spirit of helpfulness
:an inclination, impulse, or tendency of a specified kind :mood
:a special attitude or frame of mind the money-making spirit was for a time driven back J. A. Froude
:the feeling, quality, or disposition characterizing something undertaken in a spirit of fun
:a lively or brisk quality in a person or a person's actions
:a person having a character or disposition of a specified nature
:a mental disposition characterized by firmness or assertiveness denied the charge with spirit
:distillate 1: as
:the liquid containing ethanol and water that is distilled from an alcoholic liquid or mash often used in plural
:any of various volatile liquids obtained by distillation or cracking (as of petroleum, shale, or wood) often used in plural
:a usually volatile organic solvent (as an alcohol, ester, or hydrocarbon)
:prevailing tone or tendency spirit of the age
:general intent or real meaning spirit of the law
:an alcoholic solution of a volatile substance spirit of camphor
:enthusiastic loyalty school spirit
:god 1b
:to infuse with spirit
:animate hope and apprehension of feasibleness spirits all industry John Goodman
:to carry off usually secretly or mysteriously was hustled into a … motorcar and spirited off to the country W. L. Shirer
:a solution (as of gum arabic in ether) used especially for attaching false hair to the skin
:level 1
:alcohol 1c
:communication by raps held to be from the spirits of the dead
:a varnish in which a volatile liquid (as alcohol) is the solvent
:automatic writing held to be produced under the influence of spirits
:a spirit or demon that serves or prompts an individual
:the spirit of a dead person invoked by a medium to advise or prophesy
:nonconformist 2
